|chip1 = MediaTek;MT7600U; |chip2 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->

|powledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |connactled = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |spdledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |leddupcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimmin = <!-- Size of device --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device -->
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The FCC documents would indicate that this was meant to be used as an internal wireless module for some Xbox One S models.
"WN4511R", "MEDIATEK", "MODEL:MTM001/AAAAL" and "323K008123YD" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos (OEM: [[Lite-On]]).
The modular approval request letter for the [https://fccid.io/C3K1653 C3K1653 FCC ID] / [https://industrycanada.co/3048A-1653 3048A-1653 IC ID] :indicates usage of a ''[[MediaTek]]'' MT7600U ([https://fccid.io/document.php?id=2387333 UN/UAN]).
*[[Lite-On WN4511R]] â€¢ FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/C3K1653 C3K1653] (2014-09-04) [[MediaTek]] MT7600U :Dual-Band Wireless Accessory Radio ([[Microsoft 1653]]/1540) (MediaTek) :(R - [[Ralink]]/[[MediaTek]], B - [[Broadcom]], M - [[Marvell]], L - [[Realtek]])
